definition: a dad (father of a young child)
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
a mom (mother of a young child)
to report only the good news, not the bad news/to hold back unpleasant news/to sweep bad news under the carpet
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to change according to the situation (idiom); pragmatic
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
current politics/political situation of the time
to accumulate over a long period of time
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
